questions.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding age-related macular degeneration?

options.label: A
options.text: Atrophic form leads to 90% of the blindness

options.label: B
options.text: Zinc supplements halt the progression of the disease

options.label: C
options.text: Exposure to sunlight is a risk factor

options.label: D
options.text: It is more common in females

questions.correct_answer: A. Atrophic form leads to 90% of the blindness
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Atrophic form leads to 90% of the blindness The exudative or wet form of age-related macular degeneration (ARMD) usually leads to more serious vision loss and is responsible for 90% of blindness due to this disease. However, the atrophic form is more familiar, with about 90% of patients diagnosed with atrophic ARMD.

Highyeild:

It can present with a diminution of vision, distorted vision, and seeing straight lines as wavy, bent, or fuzzy. There may be shadowed areas in the central visual field, causing difficulty in reading. Macular degeneration does not cause complete blindness as it does not affect peripheral vision.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: B . Zinc supplements and antioxidant vitamins may help to lower the risk for or halt the progression. Option: C . Hereditary factors, age, nutrition, smoking, hypertension, and exposure to sunlight are all risk factors for ARMD. Option: D . Macular degeneration is more common in people older than 65, females, and whites.

Extraedge:

Ophthalmoscopically, the dry type is characterized by drusen and loss of pigment in the retina and pigment epithelium. Drusen are small, yellowish deposits on Bruch’s membrane derived from metabolic products of the visual receptors and RPE deposited as mucopolysaccharides and lipids on Bruch’s membrane.

questions.text: All the changes are seen in the atrophic form of ARMD except
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Choroidal membrane In exudative macular degeneration , new vessels form a choroidal neovascular membrane. This is not seen in the atrophic form. Exudative age-related macular degeneration presents with sudden painless loss of vision, distorted vision, and seeing straight lines, such as the side of a doorway, appear wavy, bent, or fuzzy. There may be shadowed areas in the central visual field, causing difficulty in reading.

Highyeild:

Exudative ARMD appears as an elevation of the neurosensory retina or pigment epithelium beneath which abnormal blood vessels, fluid, and haemorrhage are present.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options: A, C, and The atrophic form results in thinning of macular tissues , amorphous deposits, and pigmentation in the macula.

Extraedge:

Laser photocoagulation is also effective in sealing leaking or bleeding subretinal vessels in some eyes with exudative macular degeneration.

questions.text: A 74-year-old female patient presents with symptoms of a diminution of vision over the past few months. She also complains of seeing straight lines wavy. On the fundus examination, drusens were seen. What is the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Age-related macular degeneration This is a case of dry/ atrophic form of age-related macular degeneration (ARMD) . It can present with a diminution of vision, distorted vision, and seeing straight lines as wavy, bent, or fuzzy. There may be shadowed areas in the central visual field, causing difficulty in reading. Macular degeneration does not cause complete blindness as it does not affect peripheral vision.

Retinitis pigmentosa is a slow, degenerative retina disease, mainly occurring in both eyes, beginning in childhood and often resulting in blindness in middle or advanced age. The symptoms are night blindness and concentric contraction of the visual fields leading to tunnel vision. Option: B . Retinal detachment (RD) is characterized by transient flashes of light (photopsia), ‘floaters’ or a ‘curtain’ or ‘veil’ obscuring the field of vision. The patient experiences a fall in visual acuity when the macula becomes detached or a large bullous detachment obstructs the fovea. RD is unlikely since none of these features are present in the vignette. Option: C . Diabetic retinopathy may present with a diminution of vision with dot and blot hemorrhages and hard exudates on examination. There is no history of diabetes in this case.

questions.text: A 71-year-old male comes to the Emergency Department with sudden painless vision loss and difficulty reading. On examination, the elevation of the neurosensory retina is seen. What is the diagnosis of the patient?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Exudative age-related macular degeneration Exudative age-related macular degeneration presents with sudden painless loss of vision, distorted vision, and seeing straight lines, such as the side of a doorway, appear wavy, bent, or fuzzy. There may be shadowed areas in the central visual field, causing difficulty in reading.

Highyeild:

Exudative ARMD appears as an elevation of the neurosensory retina or pigment epithelium beneath which abnormal blood vessels, fluid, and haemorrhage are present.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A . Dry/ atrophic form of age-related macular degeneration (ARMD) presents with the gradual diminution of vision, distorted vision, and seeing straight lines as wavy, bent, or fuzzy. Ophthalmoscopically, the dry type is characterized by drusen and loss of pigment in the retina and pigment epithelium. Option: C . Central retinal artery occlusion also presents with sudden abrupt painless vision. On examination, the pupil shows a relative afferent pupillary defect (RAPD), and fundoscopy shows a blanched, nonperfused retina having the pathognomonic cherry-red spot . Option: D .Central retinal venous occlusion also presents with sudden painless loss of vision, sometimes noticed on waking up in the morning; RAPD may beS Fundoscopy shows marked venous engorgement with hyperaemic vessels, extensive retinal haemorrhages, and engorged, tortuous veins.

Extraedge:

Intravitreal agents are used to treating exudative AMD, including bevacizumab, ranibizumab, pegaptanib sodium, and aflibercept. These drugs act by inhibiting VEGF. Laser photocoagulation is also effective in sealing leaking or bleeding subretinal vessels in some eyes with exudative macular degeneration.

questions.text: A 76-year-old male comes to the Emergency Department with sudden painless vision loss and difficulty reading. On examination, the elevation of the neurosensory retina is seen. Which of the following is used to treat the condition?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above This is a case of exudative age-related macular degeneration . Intravitreal agents are used to treating exudative AMD, including bevacizumab, ranibizumab, pegaptanib sodium, and aflibercept. These drugs act by inhibiting VEGF. Laser photocoagulation is also effective in sealing leaking or bleeding subretinal vessels in some eyes with exudative macular degeneration. Exudative age-related macular degeneration presents with sudden painless loss of vision, distorted vision, and seeing straight lines, such as the side of a doorway, appear wavy, bent, or fuzzy. There may be shadowed areas in the central visual field, causing difficulty in reading.

Highyeild:

Exudative ARMD appears as an elevation of the neurosensory retina or pigment epithelium beneath which abnormal blood vessels, fluid, and haemorrhage are present.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Pegaptanib sodium - Pegaptanib sodium injection is an anti-angiogenic medicine for neovascular age-related macular degeneration. It was discovered by NeXstar Pharmaceuticals and licensed in 2000 to EyeTech Pharmaceuticals, now OSI Pharmaceuticals, for late-stage development and marketing in the United States. Option: B. Azflibercept - Aflibercept, sold under the brand names Eylea and Zaltrap, is a medication used to treat wet macular degeneration and metastatic colorectal cancer. It was developed by Regeneron Pharmaceuticals and is approved in the United States and the European Union. It is an inhibitor of vascular endothelial growth factor. Option: C. Ranibizumab - Ranibizumab, sold under the brand name Lucentis, is a monoclonal antibody fragment created from the same parent mouse antibody as bevacizumab.

Extraedge:

In exudative macular degeneration , new vessels form a choroidal neovascular membrane. This is not seen in the atrophic form.
